meanings.definition: Tending or serving to tear apart or separate
meanings.sent1: The divulsive force of the tornado ripped the trees from the ground.
meanings.sent2: The divulsive nature of the argument led to a breakdown in communication.
meanings.sent3: The divulsive effect of the stubborn child's tantrum was both impressive and exhausting.
meanings.sent4: The divulsive power of the explosion shattered the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The divulsive image of the earthquake splitting the earth in two was terrifying.

meanings.definition: Causing a sudden and violent pulling or tearing action
meanings.sent1: The divulsive motion of the roller coaster made my stomach churn.
meanings.sent2: The divulsive impact of the car crash left the onlookers in shock.
meanings.sent3: The divulsive jolt of the unexpected announcement startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The divulsive force of the tug-of-war game was unexpectedly strong.
meanings.sent5: The divulsive sensation of the bungee jump was both thrilling and terrifying.
